00061 //
00062 // IPacket Description
00063 //
00064 //    The interface class that defines a public API for 
00065 //    packet objects - data that is either about to be
00066 //    sent to or just been recieved from the network
00067 //
00069 
00070 class IPacket
00071 {
00072 public:
00073         virtual char const * const VGetType() const=0;
00074         virtual char const * const VGetData() const=0;
00075         virtual u_long VGetSize() const =0;
00076         virtual ~IPacket() { }
00077 };
00078 
00079 typedef std::list< shared_ptr <IPacket> > PacketList;
00080 
00081 
00083 //
00084 // BinaryPacket Description
00085 //
00086 //   A packet object that can be constructed all at once,
00087 //   or with repeated calls to MemCpy
00089 
00090 class BinaryPacket : public IPacket
00091 {
00092 protected:
00093         char *m_Data;
00094 
00095 public:
00096         inline BinaryPacket(char const * const data, u_long size);
00097         inline BinaryPacket(u_long size);
00098         virtual ~BinaryPacket() { SAFE_DELETE(m_Data); }
00099         virtual char const * const VGetType() const { return g_Type; }
00100         virtual char const * const VGetData() const { return m_Data; }
00101         virtual u_long VGetSize() const { return ntohl(*(u_long *)m_Data); }
00102         inline void MemCpy(char const *const data, size_t size, int destOffset);
00103 
00104         static const char *g_Type;
00105 };
00106 
00107 
00108 inline BinaryPacket::BinaryPacket(char const * const data, u_long size)
00109 {
00110         // BinaryPacket::BinaryPacket           - Chapter 16, page 606
00111         m_Data = GCC_NEW char[size + sizeof(u_long)];
00112         assert(m_Data);
00113         *(u_long *)m_Data = htonl(size+sizeof(u_long));
00114         memcpy(m_Data+sizeof(u_long), data, size);
00115 }
00116 
00117 inline BinaryPacket::BinaryPacket(u_long size)
00118 {
00119         // BinaryPacket::BinaryPacket           - Chapter 16, page 607
00120         m_Data = GCC_NEW char[size + sizeof(u_long)];
00121         assert(m_Data);
00122         *(u_long *)m_Data = htonl(size+sizeof(u_long));
00123 }
00124 
00125 inline void BinaryPacket::MemCpy(char const *const data, size_t size, int destOffset)
00126 {
00127         // BinaryPacket::MemCpy                         - Chapter 16, page 607
00128         assert(size+destOffset <= VGetSize()-sizeof(u_long));
00129         memcpy(m_Data + destOffset + sizeof(u_long), data, size);
00130 }
00131 
00133 //
00134 // TextPacket Description
00135 //
00136 //   A packet object that takes a text string.
00138 
00139 class TextPacket : public BinaryPacket
00140 {
00141 public:
00142         TextPacket(char const * const text);
00143         virtual char const * const VGetType() const { return g_Type; }
00144 
00145         static const char *g_Type;
00146 };

00150 //
00151 // NetSocket Description
00152 //
00153 //   A base class for a socket connection.
00155 
00156 class NetSocket 
00157 {
00158         friend class BaseSocketManager;
00159 
00160 public:
00161         NetSocket();
00162         NetSocket(SOCKET new_sock, unsigned int hostIP);
00163         virtual ~NetSocket();
00164 
00165         virtual void HandleInput();
00166         virtual void HandleOutput();
00167         virtual int  HasOutput() { return !m_OutList.empty(); }
00168         virtual void TimeOut() { m_timeOut=0; }
00169 
00170         bool Connect(unsigned int ip, unsigned int port, int fCoalesce = 0);
00171 
00172         void HandleException() { m_deleteFlag |= 1; }
00173         void SetBlocking(int block);
00174         void Send(shared_ptr<IPacket> pkt, bool clearTimeOut=1);
00175 
00176         void SetTimeOut(int ms=45*1000) { m_timeOut = timeGetTime() + ms; }
00177 
00178 
00179 protected:
00180     SOCKET m_sock;
00181         int m_id;                               // a unique ID given by the socket manager
00182 
00183         // note: if deleteFlag has bit 2 set, exceptions only close the
00184         //   socket and set to INVALID_SOCKET, and do not delete the NetSocket
00185     int m_deleteFlag;
00186  
00187         PacketList m_OutList;
00188         PacketList m_InList;
00189 
00190         char m_recvBuf[RECV_BUFFER_SIZE];
00191         unsigned int m_recvOfs, m_recvBegin;
00192         bool m_bBinaryProtocol;
00193 
00194     int m_sendOfs;
00195         unsigned int m_timeOut;
00196         unsigned int m_ipaddr;
00197 
00198         int m_internal;
00199         int m_timeCreated;
00200 };

00222 
00223 public:
00224         BaseSocketManager();
00225         virtual ~BaseSocketManager() { Shutdown(); }
00226

00228

00230         void Shutdown();

00243         }

00299 class RemoteEventSocket: public NetSocket 
00300 {
00301 public:
00302         enum
00303         {
00304                 NetMsg_Event,
00305                 NetMsg_PlayerLoginOk,
00306         };
00307 
00308         // server accepting a client
00309         RemoteEventSocket(SOCKET new_sock, unsigned int hostIP)         
00310         : NetSocket(new_sock, hostIP)
00311         {
00312         }
00313 
00314         // client attach to server
00315         RemoteEventSocket() { };                                                                                
00316 
00317         virtual void HandleInput();
00318 
00319 protected:
00320         void CreateEvent(std::istrstream &in);
00321 };

00326 // The only thing a network game view does is 
00327 // act as an intermediary between the server and the 'real' remote view
00328 // it listens to the same messages as a a game view
00329 // and sends them along via TCP/IP
00330 
00331 class NetworkEventForwarder : public IEventListener
00332 {
00333 public:
00334         // IEventListener
00335         NetworkEventForwarder(int sockId) { m_sockId = sockId; }
00336         bool HandleEvent( Event const & event );
00337         char const * GetName(void) { return "NetworkEventForwarder"; }
00338 
00339 protected:
00340         int m_sockId;
00341 };
00342 
00343 class NetworkGameView : public IGameView
00344 {
00345 
00346 public:
00347         // IGameView Implementation - everything is stubbed out.
00348         virtual HRESULT VOnRestore() { return S_OK; }
00349         virtual void VOnRender(double fTime, float fElapsedTime) { }
00350         virtual void VOnLostDevice() { }
00351         virtual GameViewType VGetType() { return GameView_Remote; }
00352         virtual GameViewId VGetId() const { return m_ViewId; }
00353         virtual void VOnAttach(GameViewId vid, optional<ActorId> aid);
00354         virtual LRESULT CALLBACK VOnMsgProc( AppMsg msg ) { return 0; }
00355         virtual void VOnUpdate( int deltaMilliseconds ) { };
00356 
00357         NetworkGameView(int sockId)
00358         { 
00359                 m_SockId = sockId;
00360         }
00361 
00362 protected:
00363         GameViewId m_ViewId;
00364         optional<ActorId> m_PlayerActorId;
00365         int m_SockId;
00366 };
